title: Geoff Waugh
text:
Geoff Waugh (born August 25, 1983) is a retired <a href="Canadians">Canadian</a>-<a href="Croatia">Croatia</a>n <a href="ice%20hockey">ice hockey</a> <a href="Defenseman%20%28ice%20hockey%29">defenceman</a> who last played for the <a href="Nottingham%20Panthers">Nottingham Panthers</a> of the <a href="Elite%20Ice%20Hockey%20League">Elite Ice Hockey League</a> (EIHL).
Playing career.
He played Junior "A" hockey for the <a href="Kindersley%20Klippers">Kindersley Klippers</a> of the <a href="Saskatchewan%20Junior%20Hockey%20League">Saskatchewan Junior Hockey League</a> from 2001 to 2003. The <a href="Dallas%20Stars">Dallas Stars</a> chose him 78th overall in the <a href="2002%20NHL%20Entry%20Draft">2002 NHL Entry Draft</a>.
Waugh then joined the <a href="Northern%20Michigan%20Wildcats">Northern Michigan Wildcats</a> of the <a href="NCAA">NCAA</a> for four years. In 2006-07 he turned pro with the <a href="Springfield%20Falcons">Springfield Falcons</a> and the <a href="Johnstown%20Chiefs">Johnstown Chiefs</a>.
He then signed as a free agent with the <a href="Ottawa%20Senators">Ottawa Senators</a> in 2008 and played for two seasons with their farm teams the <a href="Binghamton%20Senators">Binghamton Senators</a> and the <a href="Elmira%20Jackals">Elmira Jackals</a>. He played for the <a href="Portland%20Pirates">Portland Pirates</a>, <a href="Manitoba%20Moose">Manitoba Moose</a>, and the <a href="Victoria%20Salmon%20Kings">Victoria Salmon Kings</a> until 2011, when he joined <a href="KHL%20Medve%C5%A1%C4%8Dak%20Zagreb">KHL Medveščak Zagreb</a> of the then EBEL.
After three seasons within Zagreb, including an injury-hit inaugural season in the <a href="Kontinental%20Hockey%20League">Kontinental Hockey League</a>. The now Croatian citizen, opted to return to the EBEL, signing with Austrian club <a href="EC%20VSV">EC VSV</a> on June 15, 2014.
On June 2, 2015, Waugh left Austria as a free agent and signed a one-year deal with British club, the Nottingham Panthers of the EIHL.
